summary: This is an email chain between FBI agents discussing the status of seized electronic evidence in the Epstein case, including computers, phones, hard drives, and other media. It indicates ongoing processing of evidence as of May 2020.

persons.name: Epstein
persons.context: The case and evidence seizure are related to Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: FBI Evidence Status Update
events.description: FBI agents correspond about the status of seized electronic evidence in the Epstein case, noting quantities of computers, phones, hard drives, and other media, with approximately 20 computers still needing processing.

keyFacts: Approximately 35-40 computers, 11 phones/iPads, 21 hard drives, 4 recorders, and hundreds of DVD/CDROMs were seized in the Epstein case.
As of May 6, 2020, approximately 20 computers still needed to be processed.
The document is an internal FBI email chain discussing evidence inventory and processing status.
